subject: Re: IDE using a classpath not defined by .bash_profile
msgSnippet: ... Yeeeeeesh. It s not in the docs for JJ Edit, but that information is in the release notes on the IDE s webpage. If any other JJ Edit users run into this
messageBody:
--- In junit@yahoogroups.com, "j_cumps" <j_cumps@...> wrote:
>
> Most IDEs don't use your classpath variable. You have to configure
> the classpath in your IDE's project options. How to do this depends
> on the IDE you are using.
>
> The best way to get this question answered is to search in the IDE's
> documentation how to add a jar to your project classpath.

Yeeeeeesh. It's not in the docs for JJ Edit, but that information is
in the release notes on the IDE's webpage.

If any other JJ Edit users run into this problem, it's not in
Preferences..., but Window/Customize Toolbar..., then drag the
Classpath field to the toolbar.
